informasi, from Dutch informatie, penerangan rare
internasional, mancanegara from Javanese meaning: foreign land)
warnet a portmanteau for "warung internet" (lit. internet shop)

Malaysian: penyerangan, penjajahan (means colonialism in Indonesian), invasi

Indonesian: patroli (for police and military) (from Dutch patrolie), ronda (for civilian)

zakar from Arabic ????? male"- this word is extremely vulgar in Indonesian
column6: penis (formal), zakar from Arabic, less frequent, pelir, alat kelamin laki-laki (euphemism), kemaluan lelaki (euphemism), burung (vulgar), titit (children's slang like pee-pee")

Indonesian: persen, perseratus (less common, usually used when compared per mille)
apotek (from Dutch apotheek), farmasi (usually for medicine manufacturers)

Malaysian: gambar (In Indonesian, it means picture" or "figure")
fizik (Indonesian equivalent term, fisik, is used for term physical, e.g. aktivitas fisik [physical activity])

Indonesian: copet (portmanteau of colong dompet, wallet thief")
bajak laut, perompak (perompak in Malay, means robber")
salat (standard), shalat, sholat (from Arabic, 'sh' is usually pronounced as 's'), sembahyang
surau, musala, mushollah (from Arabic, 'sh' is usually pronounced as 's')

Malaysian: mengandung, hamil (formal, from Arabic ??????), berbadan dua lit. two bodied"
Sendirian Berhad abbreviated as Sdn Bhd (suffix), sendirian" alone means "alone""

Indonesian: produsen, produser (mainly refers to musical producers), penghasil
produk (from English and Dutch product), hasil, keluaran (more specific term for outcome)
pelacur, Wanita Tuna Susila (WTS) (Sanskrit, pronounced 'way-tay-es', i.e. moral-less women")

Malaysian: wilayah (used in Indonesian to mean 'area'), daerah (used in Indonesian to mean 'area')

tolak (It used as in tolak peluru (shot put) in Indonesian for this contex, used less primarily in Indonesian to mean 'subtract', it also means 'to refuse/reject', also common meaning in Malay when used in arithmetics)
